ns:common.topic.description: Java bytecode is the instruction set of the Java virtual machine. Each bytecode is composed by one, or in some cases two, bytes that represent the instruction, along with zero or more bytes for passing parameters.\nOf the 256 possible byte-long opcodes, 198 are currently in use, 51 are reserved for future use, and 3 instructions are set aside as permanently unimplemented.\nNote that the Java bytecode system does not directly support floating point operations beyond 32 bits -- except indirectly via bytecodes that enable the use of 64 bit and 80 bit intermediate IEEE floating point maths.
rdfs:label: Java bytecode
ns:type.object.name: Java bytecode
